clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study to Assess the Scan, Fit and Print Process for the Aveera "Patient Matched" CPAP Mask
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study to Assess the Scan, Fit and Print Process for the Aveera "Patient Matched" CPAP Mask

brief_summary.textblock: Feasibility study to assess the scan, fit and print process for the Aveera "Patient Matched" CPAP Mask

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Assess the process of scan, fit and print
2. Subjective/objective assessment of fit of the Aveera during the 2 week use for leaks and comfort
3. Ethnographic insights into the user experience of the scan, fit, print process.

primary_outcome.measure: 1) Measure time frame from scanning to mask fit and subjective patient feedback of mask fit
primary_outcome.description: Assess the clinical utility of using a 3D scanning process, printing and fit assessment

arm_group.description: This is a prospective, open label study to assess the scan, print and fit process to see if the Aveera will be able to be used with conventional CPAP therapy devices

intervention.description: Subjects will use the 3D crafted CPAP mask. All subjects will receive a mask to use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 18 years of age
- Both genders
- Currently prescribed fixed pressure CPAP or APAP for the treatment of OSA
- Currently CPAP pillows and nasal mask users
- Patients who are adherent as defined by conventional standards (i.e. 4 hours per night/70% of the nights)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unwilling to wear the AVEERA
- Concern about privacy of data
- Pregnant
- Full face mask user
- Any medical condition deemed by the investigator to pose an issue with the subject's participation.
- Upper limit of CPAP pressure of ≥ to 15 cm H20 or APAP a upper limit pressure setting of ≥17cm H2O
- Requires the use of supplemental oxygen
